pr_title: Manage Jenkins with flow layout and categories

timeline.message:
Manage Jenkins with flow layout and categories

Co-authored-by: Félix Queiruga <fqueiruga@cloudbees.com>
Adapt XPath to handle additional classes in HTML

timeline.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: I like this. We can even @Restricted(NoExternalUse.class) the getCategoryName() to ensure migration when updating core dependencies.
replies.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText: … except it doesn't seem to work for overrides.
replies.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText: well it is better than not having anything....
replies.author: jtnord

timeline.bodyText: implying you can add more - which means the string return above may return something that is not even in the enum from a "bad" plugin..
timeline.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText:
may return something that is not even in the enum from a "bad" plugin..

Hence https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/pull/4546/files#diff-9e24c3bccc9e921f1a5cc216abc25d03R4722-R4725
replies.author: daniel-beck

timeline.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: Seemed redundant. OTOH, benefit of not using reflection…
replies.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText:
benefit of not using reflection

that was what I was trying to avoid :-)
replies.author: jtnord

timeline.author: jtnord
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -131,4 +133,37 @@ public boolean getRequiresConfirmation() {
     public boolean getRequiresPOST() {
         return false;
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Category for management link, uses {@code String} so it can be done with core dependency pre-dating the version this feature was added.
+     *
+     * @return An enum value of {@link Category}.
+     * @since TODO
+     */
+    public @Nonnull String getCategory() {
+        return Category.UNCATEGORIZED.toString();
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Categories supported by this version of core.
+     *
+     * @since TODO
+     */
+    public enum Category {
+        CONFIGURATION,
+        SECURITY,
+        STATUS,
+        TROUBLESHOOTING,
+        TOOLS,
+        MISC,

replies.bodyText: you an argue the same for CONFIGURATION vs CONFIG?
replies.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: No, much more common term, especially in the group I expect to type this in successfully.
replies.author: daniel-beck

timeline.bodyText: need to catch nullPointerException unless you switch to my proposed way (as there are no annotations for plugins not upgrading core and they could heaven forbid return null without any compiler warnng)
timeline.author: jtnord

timeline.message:
Make this less stringy

Co-authored-by: James Nord <jtnord@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: urg yeah.. thought you where catching IllegalArgumentException 🤦‍♂
replies.author: jtnord

timeline.message:
Remove unnecessary TODOs

Co-authored-by: Félix Queiruga <fqueiruga@cloudbees.com>

timeline.author: timja

replies.author: daniel-beck

timeline.bodyText:
Now that I think about this, it seems like an oversight as GlobalConfiguration already had a category:
https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/blob/449c5aced523a6e66fe3d6a804e5dbfd5c5c67c6/core/src/main/java/jenkins/model/GlobalConfigurationCategory.java
cc @basil
timeline.author: jetersen

replies.bodyText: Great! It looks like these categories are relatively new (appearing first in Jenkins 2.226) and have not yet made it to an LTS release. Once my plugin's minimum required Jenkins version contains these new categories, I will start using them.
replies.author: basil

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I misunderstood. Indeed, I now see that I cannot use these categories because they are of type ManagementLink.Category rather than GlobalConfigurationCategory. Anyway, seems outside the scope of JENKINS-62445. If and when there is a working solution for plugin developers to follow regarding CasC categories, I will adopt it.
replies.author: basil
